page.title: 11Coastal Erosion
page.content: To stop longshore drift from carrying away sand from the beaches,Bournemouth Council has built groynes,including a very long one at the end of Hengistbury Head.Unfortunately this has resulted in severe erosion taking place to the east of the long groyne where the cliffs and the promenade are being eaten away.This is also happening at the neck of the promontory,near the Double Dykes.Some people think that the sea could break through and make the Head into an island unless preventative action is taken. Hengistbury Head also suffers from erosion caused by people walking over it.Where they have not kept to the paths the grass has been worn down and the rain is washing the soil away,making deep gullies in places. Conservation is being undertaken.
